11#include "common_audio/resampler/push_sinc_resampler.h"
12
13#include <cstring>
14
15#include "common_audio/include/audio_util.h"
16#include "rtc_base/checks.h"
17
18namespace webrtc {
19
20PushSincResampler::PushSincResampler(size_t source_frames,
21 size_t destination_frames)
22 : resampler_(new SincResampler(source_frames * 1.0 / destination_frames,
23 source_frames,
24 this)),
25 source_ptr_(nullptr),
26 source_ptr_int_(nullptr),
27 destination_frames_(destination_frames),
28 first_pass_(true),
29 source_available_(0) {}
30
31PushSincResampler::~PushSincResampler() {}
32
33size_t PushSincResampler::Resample(const int16_t* source,
34 size_t source_length,
35 int16_t* destination,
36 size_t destination_capacity) {
37 if (!float_buffer_.get())
38 float_buffer_.reset(new float[destination_frames_]);
39
40 source_ptr_int_ = source;
41 // Pass nullptr as the float source to have Run() read from the int16 source.
42 Resample(nullptr, source_length, float_buffer_.get(), destination_frames_);
43 FloatS16ToS16(float_buffer_.get(), destination_frames_, destination);
44 source_ptr_int_ = nullptr;
45 return destination_frames_;
46}
47
48size_t PushSincResampler::Resample(const float* source,
49 size_t source_length,
50 float* destination,
51 size_t destination_capacity) {
52 RTC_CHECK_EQ(source_length, resampler_->request_frames());
53 RTC_CHECK_GE(destination_capacity, destination_frames_);
54 // Cache the source pointer. Calling Resample() will immediately trigger
55 // the Run() callback whereupon we provide the cached value.
56 source_ptr_ = source;
57 source_available_ = source_length;
58
59 // On the first pass, we call Resample() twice. During the first call, we
60 // provide dummy input and discard the output. This is done to prime the
61 // SincResampler buffer with the correct delay (half the kernel size), thereby
62 // ensuring that all later Resample() calls will only result in one input
63 // request through Run().
64 //
65 // If this wasn't done, SincResampler would call Run() twice on the first
66 // pass, and we'd have to introduce an entire |source_frames| of delay, rather
67 // than the minimum half kernel.
68 //
69 // It works out that ChunkSize() is exactly the amount of output we need to
70 // request in order to prime the buffer with a single Run() request for
71 // |source_frames|.
72 if (first_pass_)
73 resampler_->Resample(resampler_->ChunkSize(), destination);
74
75 resampler_->Resample(destination_frames_, destination);
76 source_ptr_ = nullptr;
77 return destination_frames_;
78}
79
80void PushSincResampler::Run(size_t frames, float* destination) {
81 // Ensure we are only asked for the available samples. This would fail if
82 // Run() was triggered more than once per Resample() call.
83 RTC_CHECK_EQ(source_available_, frames);
84
85 if (first_pass_) {
86 // Provide dummy input on the first pass, the output of which will be
87 // discarded, as described in Resample().
88 std::memset(destination, 0, frames * sizeof(*destination));
89 first_pass_ = false;
90 return;
91 }
92
93 if (source_ptr_) {
94 std::memcpy(destination, source_ptr_, frames * sizeof(*destination));
95 } else {
96 for (size_t i = 0; i < frames; ++i)
97 destination[i] = static_cast<float>(source_ptr_int_[i]);
98 }
99 source_available_ -= frames;
100}
101
102} // namespace webrtc
